entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: Modeling Update (Join)
entry.content:
For all SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud ‚Äì Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) modelers, get ready to experience environment modeling like never before! We're incredibly excited to unveil our latest upgrade, packed with innovative features designed to provide better user experience and satisfaction!

In this blogpost allow me to guide you through the latest upgrade in Modeling screen starting with the Join function. The goal is not only to provide a more user-friendly interface but also to enable a faster navigation through function configuration.

Ready to supercharge your modeling experience? Let‚Äôs get started!

As the title suggests, this Modeling screen upgrade will start in Join function. As you already know, in our Join function we have different nodes such as: Input, Signature, Join Rules, and Checks. Now, the nodes such as Input, Signature, and Checks will be in Properties panel, leaving only the Join Rules node in the Join function itself.

Let‚Äôs go through the highlight of the new functionalities that a modeler can maximize in these upgrades.

Just like before, Input Function and Input (for field) still works with dropdown functionality and the Complex Selections option in Input still works with Edit Calculation button if a complex selection needs to be maintained. 

The cool added functionality now is, when a specific field needs to have a Formula or a Value Selection, you can use the Edit (Edit Selection & Mapping) button which will give you the ability to maintain the needed formula and selection just like in the old days üòâ

You might also have noticed already these two buttons next to the Input?

Yes! This is one of the features that we added in this enhancement. These are the new Copy and Paste buttons which will allow the users to copy a created field inside the modeling and paste it into this specific section. How cool is that? These Copy and Paste buttons are also located and can be maximized in Signature and Checks.

And do not worry, the dropdown functionality is still in place if the user wants to manually choose fields to be maintained in either Granularity, Selection, or Actions Fields. How cool is that!

Finally, in Checks, not only is it now easier to copy and paste the checks in the Properties panel, but modelers can also maximize the use of the new Checks dropdown option!

Checks are now grouped, so modelers will have an easy way to identify which check to select before running the function instead of expanding the checks node. Now that‚Äôs convenient!

Except for these user interface updates to the Input, Signature, and Checks nodes, everything else will stay the same, including the configuration of the Join Rules,  Since all our previous setups will continue to function, modelers don't need to take any additional action.

I hope this blogpost provides you with helpful information about this first modeling screen upgrade. Soon, this upgrade will also be applied to all functions so that modelers will have a faster and easier modeling experience! To know which function is next, you can visit our What‚Äôs New series where we announce new features and upgrades for SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud ‚Äì Standard Model! Thank you for reading!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: What‚Äôs New as of 2025-06-09?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members!

Here again to give you the latest updates in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud ‚Äì Standard Model. From Modeling screen, Administration screens such as: Teams and Settings, and Show Screen (Pivot Mode = On).

Without further ado, Let‚Äôs dive into What‚Äôs New in SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model.

 

Modeling

1. New mapping fields are now available for RFA FI-GL and RFA FI-GLI

As of today, Remote Function Adapter types, Finance General Ledger and Finance General Ledger Items, now have both Financial Period and Tax Code fields which modelers can now use when posting documents.

Finance General Ledger

header-fis_periodFiscal Period
accountgl[ 1 ]-tax_codeTax on Sales/Purchases Code
accountgl[ 2 ]-tax_codeTax on Sales/Purchases Code

Finance General Ledger Items

header-fis_periodFiscal Period
accountgl-tax_codeTax on Sales/Purchases Code

2. Modeling Update (Join)

For SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model modelers, get ready to experience the environment modeling like never before! We're incredibly excited to unveil our latest upgrade, packed with innovative features designed to provide better user experience and satisfaction! For full details about this update, visit SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: Modeling Update (Join)

 

Show Screen (Pivot Mode = On)

As we know, when the pivot mode is set to "On" in the Show screen, the can show the totals for a particular column.

As an addition to this feature, users will now be able to customize the "Result" label for totals by following the simple steps below.

  1. Choose the column header option
  2. Choose Change Aggregation Label and adjust the label text
  3. and then choose Confirm

 

Teams

As part of the continuous enhancement to have flexibility in team management, the team collection which can contain child teams is now possible in the application. 

For the configuration and more info, you may refer to SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model ‚Äì Introducing Team Collection blogpost.

 

Settings Screen

1. Email Notifications Update

To align with SAP's email handling capabilities, we are now transitioning from the current SAP SMTP service to a new solution, ANS (Alert Notification Service). For the full details, visit this blogpost SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: 3 Things You Need to Know About the Update in Email Notifications

This update also includes user interface improvements which will provide admin with the ability to choose the configured destination from BTP in the Settings screen.

2. For role collection ADMIN_USER_RESTRICTED, we introduced a small change in its restriction to provide more secure granularity in which this role collection will now not have the ability to perform any password activities such as reset or unlock of the current database user password.

ADMIN_USER_RESTRICTED

This change does not affect other role collections such as:

SETTINGS and ADMIN_USER_ALL

The SETTINGS_READ role will remain the same with read-only access to the Administration Settings screen.

3. SAP Cloud ALM Integration in PaPM Cloud Standard Model

We're excited to announce the integration of SAP Profitability and Performance Management (PaPM) Cloud Standard Model with SAP Cloud ALM. This integration allows you to monitor the health of your PaPM application in one place.

To use this integration, you need to be subscribed to SAP PaPM Cloud and SAP Cloud ALM. The integration focuses on health monitoring, and you can track key aspects like:

  • Connection Monitoring: Checks if PaPM can connect to the database.
  • Availability Monitoring: Confirms the database is running and logs any errors.

In the Administration Settings screen, you can define which destination, previously configured for SAP Cloud ALM in SAP BTP, will be used in PaPM. This new option is available in the "Destination Settings" section. You can choose the destination from a dropdown menu filled with pre-configured SAP BTP destinations. The field allows for quick search. As you type, a dropdown shows filtered results, making it simple to find the desired destination

If the destination name is not specified on the Settings page, the system will automatically check for the existence of the default destination name,  "PaPM_CloudALM," in SAP BTP. The system will also check for the default destination if the user attempts to save an empty destination field. If the default destination is created in SAP BTP, it will be populated in the field. If it is not defined, the field will remain empty.

We have added a field under the Application Shell Integration Settings section where you can add your SAP Cloud ALM link.

When you add a link for SAP Cloud ALM under the Application Shell Integration Settings section, a new tile will be activated in the app switcher on the Shell Page, from which the user can access the SAP Cloud ALM application.

For more information, visit  Settings in the Application Help Portal.  

For more information on integrating SAP Cloud ALM with SAP Profitability and Performance Management and creating a destination for it in SAP BTP, visit  SAP Cloud ALM Setup in the Administration Guide.

That is all! If you want to monitor and recall what are the new features and updates from SAP PaPM Cloud - Standard Model, you may follow the tag PaPMCloudSMWhatsNew thank you for reading!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Mass Upload of Process Instances
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members! 

I'm excited to share the improvements made to the Process Management screen in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM).‚ÄØTo improve efficiency when working with complex processes that contain a large number of similar activities, a new functionality has been introduced: Mass Upload of Process Settings. This feature enables users to download the configuration of existing process instances in the form of an XLSX file, make changes in required sheets, and then upload those changes back into the application to create multiple new instances simultaneously. 

Two new buttons have been added to the top toolbar ‚Äì Download Process Settings and Upload Process Settings. The first enables users to download the configuration of existing instances as a template for further use, while the second is used for uploading a prepared XLSX file with new process instances. 

Downloading Process Instances 

To download the configuration of an existing process instance, select one or more instances from the list and click the Download Process Settings button. If only one instance is selected, a single XLSX file containing its configuration will be downloaded. In case multiple instances are selected, a ZIP file containing one XLSX file per instance will be downloaded.  

The name of the downloaded file will include the environment ID, version, and process instance ID, for example, RPM_TS05_PROC07.  

Each XLSX file has the same structure and includes five sheets:  

  • Process - Contains general information about process instances, including the following columns: Process, Description, Process Type, Process State, and Start Date. 
  • Activities - Contains information about activities from selected process instances, including the following columns: Process, Activity, Description, Performer, Reviewer, Start Date, and End Date.
  • Parameters - Contains information about defined parameters with the following columns: Process, Field, and Value.
  • Selections - Contains information about the defined selection with the following columns: Process, Selection Field, Logical Operator, Operator Type, Selection Min. Value and Selection Max. Values. For selections that don't require a minimum and maximum value, the value under‚ÄØSelection Min. Value‚ÄØwill be taken as the selection value during upload.
  • Help - Provides additional information that might be useful when configuring the other four tabs. This tab is not considered during the upload process. 

While the structure and column order are always the same, the row content varies depending on which instance is selected ‚Äì i.e., which activities, parameters, and selections it contains. 

Configuration of the XLSX file: 

  1. The XLSX file must maintain its structure exactly without changing the order of the columns, otherwise, the content cannot be placed correctly. 
  2. The Process State field on the Process sheet and the Logical Operator and Operator Type fields on the Selections sheet have dropdown menus, allowing you to easily select predefined available options. You can find more information about these values on the Help sheet. 
  3. The uploaded file should only contain activity, parameters and selections that exist and are active in the target process instance. If an XLSX file contains some elements that are not defined in the target process template, the upload process will be canceled. 
  4. If any elements (parameters, process selections, activities) that are part of the process template are not mentioned in the XLSX file, they will be copied from the target process instance. 
  5. If a field is defined in the Parameter or Selection sheet but has no value, it will be configured as an empty field. 
  6. Data is linked to the Process ID in the first column of each sheet. Rows with the same Process ID will be used to create a single process instance, and subsequent rows will be used accordingly. 
  7. The maximum number of process instances that can be uploaded within a single XLSX file is 50. If you exceed this limit, the system will automatically cancel the upload and display an appropriate error message. 

Uploading Process Instances 

Once you have finished configuring new instances in the XLSX file, the next step is to upload the file back into the PaPM application. On the Process Management screen, you first need to select one base instance, either the one for which you downloaded process settings or another instance with the same configuration, meaning using the same process template, so they contain the same Activity, Parameters and Selection fields. Clicking the Upload Process Settings button opens a file upload dialog, where you select the XLSX file that was configured in the previous steps. After confirming, the application will create new instances based on the data from all four tabs. 

It is important to note that the upload will not be successful if there is any error in the data, even if just one instance in the file is invalid, the entire upload process will be canceled, and no instances will be created. In such cases, a red toast message will appear, notifying you of the failure. For more details about the error, refer to the Message Log. 

Note: For the value field, no data validation will occur during the upload process, meaning the value field will not be checked if the values satisfy the defined configuration for that field. The process instance will be uploaded successfully without displaying any warning messages. This type of error can only be seen after uploading and expanding specific process instances, parameters, or selections, depending on where the error is present.   

The new Mass Upload of Process Settings functionality significantly speeds up the configuration of multiple similar processes, reduces manual work, and enables better standardization in the SAP PaPM Cloud SM environment. 

I hope you find these updates helpful!  

Stay tuned for the latest updates and insights in the next one. Thank you!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Post-Installation ‚Äì ABAP Steps
entry.content:
Introduction 

Hello everyone, 

Have you ever tried buying a new phone that includes a manual that teaches you how to set up the device? Did you try to follow it through and perform the steps provided? In PaPM, there is also a manual that will guide you through the steps required after the installation of SAP Profitability and Performance Management 3.0. This procedure is called post-installation and will help you ensure that the application works in the live client where the system is activated. 

We have three parts of post-installation: 

  • ABAP steps 
  • HANA steps 
  • Default environment steps 

You need to perform manual steps after a successful installation of‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØ3.0 or a support package update to ensure the application works consistently. 

 

ABAP Steps 

The ABAP steps you need to carry out depend on your individual situation: 
For a newly installed‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØ3.0 system, you need to perform the steps from Support Package 01 up to the latest patch level installed in the system. 

For a Support Package update, ensure you perform the steps mentioned in the newly implemented Support Packages. 

Note: If you were originally on SP07 and then move to SP19, you need to perform all the steps required for SP08, SP09, SP10, SP11, SP12, SP13, SP14, SP15, SP16, SP17, SP18, and SP19. 

 

Set Namespaces 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØis installed. In‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØthere are certain namespaces that need to be set to‚ÄØ‚Äúmodifiable‚Äù‚ÄØup until SP13. From SP14 onwards, this is no longer necessary and can be skipped  

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter activation issues with the system prompting you to set the namespace to modifiable. You will also encounter issues during transport when after-import has initiated the activation/generation of objects.  

More information: 
PaPM is customizing. Activation in PaPM does not just involve SE38 inactive report -- it involves a creation of artifacts as well (function Ytables, procedures, process chains, queries, and so on). Therefore, ensure you follow the steps described in the Administration Guide under Set Namespaces. 

 

Establish Database Connection 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØis installed. You can specify the database connection name within the environment settings in‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management.  

From SP22 onwards, you can make use of the DEFAULT database connection already available in Netweaver ABAP. You no longer need to create a DBCON database connection. All the sample content environments from SP22 onwards use the DEFAULT database connection. 

If you have already established the DBCON database connection for previous support packages in your environment, you can continue using them or you can change all your environments to use the DEFAULT connection. 

 

Create RFC Destination 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is installed. 

The default naming convention for the RFC destination is ‚Äú<System_ID>CLNT<Client>‚Äù. For example, ‚ÄúPERCLNT100‚Äù, where ‚ÄúPER‚Äù is the system ID and ‚Äú100‚Äù is the client on which you want to configure SAP Profitability and Performance Management functions. By following this naming convention, you will not need to apply any additional settings in the system. However, if your system landscape requires you to use a different name for the RFC destination, you need to register the new name in the Connection Management application with connection source ‚ÄúAfter Import‚Äù. For more information about maintaining connections to external systems, see the Connection Management section in the Application Help for SAP Profitability and Performance Management. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter issues during transport.  

For more information, see Create RFC Destination. 

 

Create Local SAP System Alias 

Since SAP Profitability and Performance Management or NXI services need to be assigned to a local SAP Gateway named ‚ÄúLOCAL‚Äù, it is mandatory to have this created in the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is being activated. 

The system alias is the result of the routing for an inbound request on SAP Gateway and it can be a remote or a local system. If the system alias is flagged as a local SAP GW instance, it means that the system that is responsible for processing (managing and storing) the data of an inbound request is the local SAP Gateway instance itself. Therefore, testing this item is leaning more on connection settings related to activation of NXI services. 

For more information, see Creating an SAP System Alias. 

 

Create Semantic Object 

Semantic objects are delivered in the underlying SAP_UI component SPs. The semantic object of SAP Profitability and Performance Management will be delivered in SAP_UI 750 SP12. If your system is already patched to SAP_UI 750 SP12, the semantic object of SAP Profitability and Performance Management is automatically available. 

Note:  
If your system is on SAP_UI 750 SP10 or SAP_UI 750 SP11, you need to create the semantic object of SAP Profitability and Performance Management in every system where you want to use the SAP Fiori apps for SAP Profitability and Performance Management. 

For more information on the procedure, see Create Semantic Object. 

 

Activate Deep HANA Integration 

Note that in SAP BW/4HANA systems, Deep HANA integration is switched on by default. You can go to transaction SE11 and enter the table name RSPLS_HDB_ACT to see the entries. Since this is a cross-client activity, you can do this in any client within the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is installed. To do so, follow the procedure described in Activate Deep HANA Integration. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
The maintenance dialog for RSPLS_HDB_ACT is incomplete or not defined. 

Message no. SV037 

Diagnosis 
The called function with the view/table RSPLS_HDB_ACT needs a special maintenance dialog which, however, either does not exist at all, or does not exist completely. 

System Response 
The called function cannot be performed. 

 

Set Number Range Intervals 

This step must be performed for every client in the system where‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØis used. 

Before operating‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management, set the number range intervals for the following number range objects using transaction‚ÄØSNRO. Ensure that you enter‚ÄØ‚Äú01‚Äù‚ÄØin the‚ÄØNo.‚ÄØcolumn (not just‚ÄØ‚Äú1‚Äù). 

For the‚ÄØProcess ID‚ÄØobject, maintaining the number range interval is optional. It is only required if you want the system to suggest the process ID automatically during the creation of the process instance. 

Note: 
The number range intervals listed below are reserved for the SAP sample content. To avoid duplicate ID errors, make sure that the number range intervals listed below are not used: 

Possible issues when not performed: 
Transporting environments across systems/clients where number range interval definitions for /NXI/* number range objects are identical could lead to serious inconsistencies. When you are setting up the landscape, you therefore need to make sure that the number range intervals do not overlap and are unique. 

 

Activate All NXI Services 

This step is a cross-client setup that must be revisited for‚ÄØevery‚ÄØsupport package update activity. In‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management, there are specific NXI services that need to be activated before you can use applications under‚ÄØModeling,‚ÄØExecution,‚ÄØand‚ÄØSystem Reports. 

Note: 
Since PaPM is accessed via browser, these webdynpro, bsp, ui5_ui5, OData should all be activated. 

For more information on the procedure, see Activate All NXI Services. 

 

Assign SAP System Alias to NXI Services 

The local SAP system alias created in the previous step must be assigned to all NXI services. 

For more information on the procedure, see Assign SAP System Alias to NXI Services. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter dump like ‚Äú500 Internal Server Error‚Äù when launching My Environments or any PaPM application. 

 

Publish OData Services 

To integrate the processing service, you need to publish the service group following the steps in Publish OData Services. 

 

Adjust Maximum Record Length (RADTBCON viewlen) 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØis installed. 

Note: 
If your system is on SAP_BASIS version 753 (for example, BW/4HANA 2.0 or S/4HANA 1909) and above, you can skip this step. 

If you intend to import the sample content or use‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØwith a record length greater than 4030, perform the following steps in Adjust Maximum Record Length (RADTBCON viewlen). 

Possible issues when not performed: 
PaPM function table activation is failing when total length of all the fields exceeds more than 4030. Error: table Y032PUD000 is too long >4030 
msg: Y032PUD000 -> no 4030 -> no relevant 

 

Adjust Maximum Record Length (RADTBCON tablen) 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØis installed. 

Note: 
If your system is on SAP_BASIS version 753 (for example, BW/4HANA 2.0 or S/4HANA 1909) and above, you can skip this step. 

If you intend to import the sample content or use‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØwith a record length greater than 4030, perform the following steps in Adjust Maximum Record Length (RADTBCON tablen). 

 

Maintain User Groups 

To enable individual users to use the‚ÄØManage and Deploy Processes application, you need to assign them to a user group. 

For more information, see Maintain User Groups. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You will not be able to see the process instance and activities created.  

 

Migrate Models 

This step is valid when patching to‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØ3.0 SP04 onwards. 

An enhanced UI for models with sync and mapping functionalities is available. Run the migration report‚ÄØ/NXI/P1_MIGRATE_MODELS‚ÄØto activate functions configured with the old UI. 

Proceed with the steps in Migrate Models. 

 

Set Up Dual Control for Usage in Process Execution (Optional) 

If you intend to use the dual control functionality (with performers and reviewers) including email notification when you run processes or activities, you need to set up the basic workflow and perform the SAPconnect administration or check that this has already been done. 

For more information about the basic workflow setup, see Automatic Workflow Customizing. 

 

Implement Important SAP Notes 

Users should be able to implement important SAP Notes. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter issues when running the Writer function. 

You need this also to achieve the Editable Visual Modeler. 

For more information, see Implement Important SAP Notes. 

 

Create Tool BW Client 

To integrate‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØwith BW, you can activate the BW client in the following scenarios: 

  • In a different client than‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØ(for example, the BW is in client 100;‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØis in client 200, but in the same system) 
  • In the same client as‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØ(for example, BW and‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØare both in client 200). 

For more information on the procedure, see Create Tool BW Client. 

Note: 
You need to recheck the RSADMINA table in transaction code SE16 of the BI Client and verify that BW_USER, BWMANDT, BWMANDTRFC, and TPBWMANDTRFC are properly populated. 

 

Adjust RSADMINA Table (Column TPBWMANDTRFC) 

In the live client for‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management, assign the BW RFC destination to the TPBWMANDTRFC‚ÄØcolumn‚ÄØin the RSADMINA table. 

For more information on the procedure, see Adjust RSADMINA Table (Column TPBWMANDTRFC). 

Note: 
For additional information about how to modify the RSADMINA table, see SAP Notes‚ÄØ1949194‚ÄØand‚ÄØ1911225. 

 

Create SAP HANA Source System 

There are two ways to create the source system:  

  • Via BW Client  
  • Via SAP HANA Studio 

For BW Client, follow the steps in Create SAP HANA Source System.  
For SAP HANA Studio, follow the steps in Create SAP HANA Source System.  

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter issues like logical systems for a particular database schema does not exist. 

Note: 
If you configure the‚ÄØModel Table‚ÄØfunction and‚ÄØModel View‚ÄØfunction in the environments of‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØto point to sources from other schemas, you also need to carry out the steps listed above for every schema. 

 

Activate Planning Function Type 

This activity is to be performed in the client where BW has been activated. To do this, follow the procedure in Activate Planning Function Type. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter issues with the Writer function or cannot create ADSO InfoProvider, Model BW.  

 

Activate Query Element Variables 

This activity needs to be performed in the client where BW has been activated. To do this, follow the procedure in Activate Planning Function Type. 

Now we are already done with the ABAP Steps, we can already proceed with the other blogpost that tackles the HANA and default environment steps. You can check it through this link.

entry.title: SAP PaPM Post-Installation ‚Äì HANA Steps
entry.content:
Introduction 

The first part of this blog covers only the ABAP steps. In this second part, we will discuss the HANA steps and default environment steps. 

We have three parts of post-installation: 

  • ABAP steps 
  • HANA steps 
  • Default environment steps 

HANA Steps 

The steps in this section need to be performed in SAP HANA Studio. 

The HANA steps you need to carry out depend on your individual situation: 

  • For a newly installed‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØ3.0 system, you need to perform the steps from Support Package 01 up to the latest patch level installed in the system. 
  • For a Support Package update, ensure you perform the steps mentioned in the newly implemented Support Packages.  

Note: If you were originally on SP07 and then moved to SP19, you need to perform all the steps required for SP08, SP09, SP10, SP11, SP12, SP13, SP14, SP15, SP16, SP17, SP18, and SP19. 

 

Create NXI Schema in SAP HANA Studio 

The steps in this section need to be performed in SAP HANA Studio. Follow the steps in the procedure section in Create NXI Schema in SAP HANA Studio. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You will not be able to activate all modeling functions as the required procedure cannot be generated if this step was not performed. 

 

Grant Full Authorization to SAP DB Connection User in SAP HANA Studio 

The steps in this section need to be performed in SAP HANA Studio Follow the steps in the procedure section in Grant Full Authorization to SAP DB Connection User in SAP HANA Studio. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter activation issues where the procedure you need to run or activate is included in NXI schema. 

 

Grant SELECT and EXECUTE Authorizations to _SYS_REPO User in SAP HANA Studio 

The steps in this section need to be performed in SAP HANA Studio. Follow the steps in the procedure section in Grant SELECT and EXECUTE Authorizations to _SYS_REPO User in SAP HANA Studio. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter authorization issues when activating functions like model views. 
 

Assign System Privileges to SAP DB Connection User 

Prerequisites 
Grant the system privilege‚ÄØCATALOG READ‚ÄØto the SAP DB Connection User in the SAP HANA database. 

Context 
Grant the following system privileges to the SAP DB Connection User in the SAP HANA database if you intend to use the following: 

A virtual table or view using the HANA SDA function type in the model view 

  • CREATE REMOTE SOURCE 
  • DATA ADMIN 

File Adapter function 

  • IMPORT 
  • EXPORT 

SAP HANA R Script function type in the remote function adapter 

  • CREATE R SCRIPT 

For more information on the procedure, see Assign System Privileges to SAP DB Connection User.  

 

Adjust SAP HANA DB Parameters 

If you intend to use the upload/download functionality of the‚ÄØFile Adapter‚ÄØfunction, you need to adjust the following parameters in the SAP HANA database as described in Adjust SAP HANA DB Parameters.  

Possible issues when not performed: 
Activation/Run of file adapter function results in a generation error where the system cannot open the CSV file. This indicates that this step was not properly configured. 

 

Maintain Schema Mapping for NXI Schema 

If you intend to use the upload/download functionality of the‚ÄØFile Adapter‚ÄØfunction, you need to adjust the following parameters in the SAP HANA database which as described in Adjust SAP HANA DB Parameters.  

Note: 
In maintaining the schema mapping, the physical schema will always be the owner which can be checked by logging in to the corresponding PaPM client and going to System > Status. 

 

Install SAP HANA Automated Predictive Library for Machine Learning (Optional) 

If you intend to use the Machine Learning function, you need to install SAP HANA Automated Predictive Library (APL) 1904 as the minimum version requirement in the SAP HANA database. 

Follow the procedure below to grant mandatory roles for using the‚ÄØMachine Learning‚ÄØfunction to the SAP DB Connection User in SAP HANA Studio as described in Install SAP HANA Automated Predictive Library for Machine Learning (Optional). 

Possible issues when not performed: 
If you do not assign these roles, you might encounter insufficient privilege issues. 

 

Default Environment Steps 

Before performing this step, ensure that all previous post-installation tasks are completed.  

The steps in this section need to be performed in SAP NetWeaver. This needs to be done for every client in the system where‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØwill be used. 

Depending on the NetWeaver version, you need to use either Client Copy Tool SCC1 or Client Copy Tool SCC1N. Starting from SAP_BASIS 758, the transaction code SCC1 has been deprecated. Instead, the new SCC1N, which is available from SAP_BASIS 755 onwards, needs to be used. Therefore, for sample content, SCC1 can still be used if your system is below SAP_BASIS 755. However, for systems running SAP_BASIS 755 or higher, transaction code SCC1N must be used. 

Note: 
For more information on how to update the‚ÄØEnvironment Template for Default Settings‚ÄØSAP default environment, see SAP Note‚ÄØ3396866. 

Procedure:

1. If you had set up the target client by copying client‚ÄØ‚Äú000‚Äù‚ÄØafter installation of or upgrade to the latest support package of‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØ3.0 using any of the‚ÄØSAP_CUST-based profiles, the default SAP environment is already copied over from client‚ÄØ‚Äú000‚Äù. You can skip the next step and go to step 3. 

2. However, if the target client already existed before installation of or upgrade to the latest support package of‚ÄØSAP Profitability and Performance Management‚ÄØ3.0 or if the client was created without a client copy from client‚ÄØ‚Äú000‚Äù‚ÄØusing an‚ÄØSAP_CUST-based profile, perform one the following steps: 

  • For SAP_BASIS versions older than 755 use transaction code SCC1 by following the procedure described in‚ÄØSAP_BASIS 754 or Older. 
  • For SAP_BASIS versions at 755 or newer, use transaction code SCC1N by following the procedure described in‚ÄØSAP_BASIS 755 or Newer. 

3. Launch transaction‚ÄØ/NXI/P1_MODEL‚ÄØand check under the‚ÄØSample Content‚ÄØnode whether the delivered SAP default environment‚ÄØEnvironment Template for Default Settings‚ÄØexists. If it does not exist, repeat all previous steps. 

4. Launch transaction‚ÄØSE38, enter program‚ÄØ/NXI/P1_GENERATE_SQLFUNCTIONS‚ÄØand choose‚ÄØExecute. Choose‚ÄØExecute‚ÄØagain with the default input parameters. This results in successful log messages. 

5. If you intend to use the‚ÄØMachine Learning‚ÄØfunction (transaction‚ÄØSE38), enter program‚ÄØ/NXI/P1_GENERATE_SQLFUNCTIONS‚ÄØand choose Execute. Enter‚ÄØ/NXI/P1_GENERATE_SQLMLWRP‚ÄØas‚ÄØInclude‚ÄØand choose‚ÄØExecute‚ÄØagain. 

There you have it! Now your system is stabilized, you can already proceed in using it.  

If you have any questions, feel free to ask here under SAP Community Questions. For more blog posts, you can check the SAP Community Blog Posts. 

I hope this helps and I encourage you to share it to your friends!

entry.title: Integrated Support Experience: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model with SAP Built-in Support
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members!

I‚Äôm thrilled to share an awesome upgrade for SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM): the SAP Built-In Support feature which used to be available only in the Universal Model, has now been added to the Standard Model as well.

Now, more users can quickly find helpful resources, engage with the SAP Community and submit support incidents directly from the application - making it easier to get assistance whenever it‚Äôs needed.

In this post, I‚Äôll walk you through:

  • How to access the SAP Built-In Support within SAP PaPM Cloud SM
  • Key features that make this integrated support experience seamless and efficient

Ready to explore? Let‚Äôs get started!

 

How to access the SAP Built-In Support within SAP PaPM Cloud SM

SAP Built-In Support is readily accessible across all SAP PaPM Cloud SM screens except for the Provisioning screen. See that support icon in the top-right corner? Give it a click to open the application.

 

Key features that make this integrated support experience seamless and efficient

Check out the features designed to provide guidance and simplify access to needed support.


Search Support Knowledge

  • No more switching websites to find the answers you need. Now, you can search for help right inside SAP PaPM.
  • Access articles from both SAP‚Äôs public knowledge base and the SAP Help Portal, all in one place.

  • Sort search results by relevance or by date, whether newest or oldest first.

  • Filter your search by product, component, category, or a specific date range.


Recommended Links

  • When you open Built-In Support, you‚Äôll immediately see the recommended links section. These static links provide instant access to essential SAP PaPM resources:
    • SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud on SAP Help Portal
      Learn how to implement and use SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud
    • SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud | SAP Community
      Become part of our vibrant SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud community
    • What‚Äôs New Blog Posts | SAP Community
      Learn what‚Äôs new in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud


Manage ServiceNow Cases with Ease

  • With SAP PaPM Built-in Support, managing ServiceNow cases / incidents is now simpler than before. By signing in with an authorized S-USER account, users can easily create new cases, monitor progress, and close them. Updates are automatically synchronized between ServiceNow and SAP PaPM.
  • Follow these steps to get started:
  1. Sign In and Access the Dashboard
    1. Open SAP PaPM Built-In Support and sign in with your SAP Universal ID (make sure it‚Äôs linked to your S-USER account).
    2. Once logged in, the dashboard will display two options: ‚ÄúGet Support‚Äù and ‚ÄúView Cases‚Äù.

       

  2. Create a New Case
    1. Click ‚ÄúGet Support‚Äù and fill in the necessary details below:
      • Subject: Title of the case / incident
      • Description: Describe the issue in detail including what happened, how to recreate it, expected vs. actual results, error messages etc.
      • Component: Specify the related SAP component (for example, LOD-PER-CLD)
      • Business Impact: Choose the appropriate priority level
      • Attachments: Upload any supporting documents such as screenshots or logs to help SAP address the incident more efficiently

    2. Click the ‚ÄúCreate Case‚Äù button.

       

  3. Track and Update Cases
    1. Click ‚ÄúView Cases‚Äù to monitor all your open cases.


       
    2. Click the ‚ÄúReply‚Äù button to respond, add information, or view updates from SAP.



  4. Close a Case
    1. When your issue is resolved, simply hit the ‚ÄúClose Case‚Äù button to finalize it.

 

I hope this overview makes you feel more at ease trying out the SAP PaPM Built-In Support.
Thanks for reading and stay tuned for more updates and new features in upcoming posts. Until next time!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: What‚Äôs New as of 2025-07-07?
entry.content:
Fellow SAP Community Members,

After a bit of hiatus, it feels good to be back sharing knowledge with the community! And can you believe that we‚Äôre halfway through 2025? July brings a fresh opportunity to connect and I am thrilled to highlight the latest updates in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM). With summer in full swing, let‚Äôs dive in and flow straight into the stream of SAP PaPM Cloud SM‚Äôs innovative new features! 

I. Administration Settings | SAP Cloud Transport Management 

Administrators of the SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model tenant can now specify the SAP Cloud Transport Management (SAP cTMS) Destination name. Authorized users can access this setting via the SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model's Menu: Administration > Settings > Destination Settings: SAP Cloud Transport Management. 

A dropdown list of configured destination/s in SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) will be displayed:

If you are following the SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud tag, you might recall that an informative blogpost about SAP PAPM Cloud SM integration with SAP cTMS was published at the beginning of this year by one of my colleagues. In case you are curious how to fulfill this integration point here's the link. Additionally, check the official documentation for SAP Cloud Transport Management ‚ÄØSetup

II. Process Management | Download and Upload of Process Instances 

For the SAP PaPM Cloud Processing Management screen users, a new feature in Standard Model enhances the Process Management Screen by introducing the ability to mass upload process settings. With this functionality, users can download existing process instance configurations as XLSX files, make changes in a spreadsheet application, and then upload the file to create up to 50 new process instances at once. The XLSX file structure includes predefined tabs for processes, activities, parameters, and selections, enabling users to manage large-scale configurations efficiently.

Two new buttons have been added to the top toolbar: Download Process Settings and Upload Process Settings. 

This update simplifies process creation, reduces manual input, and ensures greater consistency when working with similar process templates. A more detailed blogpost will be released soon discussing this new feature.  Meanwhile you can check the official documentation here: Download and Upload Process Instance Settings

 

III. Modeling | Run functions with Parameters and Selections 

For the avid modelers out there, running executable functions have been significantly improved with the introduction of Run with Parameters and Selections button in the Modeling screen: 

 To fulfil an execution with Parameters and Selections previously, the following steps are required: 

  1. Creating a Process Template
  2. Manually adding Parameters and Selections in the Calculation Unit Details section 
  3. Creating an Execution Activity that triggered the desired function. 

With the Run Functions with Parameters and Selections feature, the entire process is streamlined. When a executable function is selected and Run with Parameters and Selections button is clicked, a pop-up window will be displayed showing all parameters and selections defined in the Calculation Unit Details.

Moreover, the modeler has an option to use an existing Process Template to copy its Parameters and Selections value. The example below shows Parameters and Selections being automatically filled from Process Template Q1 2025:

 For more information related to running functions with Parameters and Selections, please refer to Functions Management.

IV. Integration with Built-in Support Service 

Finally, SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model is now officially integrated with SAP Built-In Support Service. This feature aims to provide users with quick access to SAP Documentation and enable them to manage incidents directly within the application with the exception of the Provisioning screen.  

SAP Built-in Support has the following key features: 

  1. Search Support Knowledge 
    Enables users to conveniently search and access information from both SAP public knowledge articles and the SAP Help Portal. 

  2.  Recommended Links 
    Users now see a list of static and helpful links including: 
    1. SAP PaPM Cloud on SAP Help Portal
    2. SAP PaPM Cloud on SAP Community 
    3. What‚Äôs New Blog Posts on SAP Community
       
  3. Managing ServiceNow cases within SAP PaPM 
    For further support, signed-in users can effortlessly manage ServiceNow (SNow) cases directly within SAP PaPM Built-in Support. From creating, viewing and updating the case‚Äôs status, these can be done within SAP PaPM Cloud integrated with the Get Support option.

    If you're interested to know more about the Integrated Support Experience, a dedicated blogpost has been published recently by one of my colleagues: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model with SAP Built-in Support


I hope these new SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model enhancements have sparked new possibilities for your projects. Keep riding the wave of innovation and share your insights with the SAP Community.

Until we sail into the next update, bye for now!

entry.title: Administration of SAP PAPM Cloud using BYOD Standalone SAP HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

In my previous blog post, SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Subscription with BYOD plan, I have shared to you how to subscribe with the newly release plan of SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud(SAP PAPM Cloud) which is the Bring Your Own Database(BYOD) plan.

With this new plan, you can maximize the SAP PAPM Cloud solution to perform high-volume data calculations and processing with more efficiency from your existing Standalone SAP HANA Cloud Database(Standalone HCDB) and SAP Datasphere.

What do we mean by efficiency? Imagine, your high-volume data is already sitting on your existing Standalone HCDB or SAP Datasphere where your SAP PAPM Cloud is mapped or connected. Therefore, creation of connections like Remote Source is not needed as you only need to perform the proper granting of privileges to technical schemas of your SAP PAPM Cloud.

Sounds cool right? Before we proceed on how you can perform integration such as the scenario above, it is important for you to know first that the Default and BYOD plan are still functionally the same. Absolutely no difference and still uses one code line.

The only difference is just the plan itself.

Alright, I hope that‚Äôs clear for us. Let‚Äôs now proceed with what‚Äôs happening when we subscribed to a BYOD plan of SAP PAPM Cloud.

Note: This blog post focuses on the usage of Standalone HCDB as the database in BYOD plan of SAP PAPM Cloud. Please stay tuned for the next blog post focusing on SAP Datasphere as the database in BYOD Plan.

Important topics are divided into 3 chapters so you can focus on what is relevant for your use case.

  1. Introducing technical users in Standalone HCDB.
  2. Authorization Grants for Standard Model
  3. Authorization Grants for Universal Model

Introducing technical users in Standalone HCDB BYOD plan

Since you can use multiple SAP PAPM Cloud tenants on one Standalone HCDB it is necessary for you to know what are the available schemas you can use to perform such integration in your own database.

SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like user

Once you subscribed to  SAP PAPM Cloud that uses BYOD plan, a user will be generated in Administration > Settings that you can use to login on your Standalone HCDB.

SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>_RT.

Please take note of this IDs as it will be the indicator who owns the artifact on the Database level in case you have multiple tenants connected to your Standalone HCDB.

Please take note that the Database user above does not equate to the roles granted to SAP_PAPM_ADMIN from default subscription. In BYOD, you have the freedom to grant the roles which you think are needed for your users.

If you wish to add roles like those granted for SAP_PAPM_ADMIN default plan by default, you may visit this, Database Role PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE to check the roles. 

Below is a sample step on how you can perform the granting of roles:

 a.    Create PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE example:

CREATE ROLE PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE;

b.   Using the information in Database Role PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE, perform the following SQL, example:

GRANT CATALOG READ TO PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE;

To verify you may check in the Database the Role Management section in Database.

Do this for all the succeeding grants.

c.   Once done, assign this role to the SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like user which can be found in database settings, example:

GRANT PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE TO SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>;

Technical schemas on Standalone HCDB BYOD plan

For you to have an idea with how you can understand the naming convention of schema available after BYOD subscription, refer to the screenshot and table below.

Model

Default Subscription

BYOD Subscription

Standard Model

SAP_PAPM

SAP_PAPM_SM_<TENANTID> is the schema where all artifacts from Standard Model can be found

Standard Model

SAP_PAPM_ADMIN

SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>_RT is the database username in Database Settings 

Universal Model

SAP_PAPM_UM

SAP_PAPM_UM_<TENANTID> is the schema where all artifacts from Universal Model can be found

Standard Model

Following the procedures added in the help portal Connections, you may start performing Inbound and Outbound scenarios for Standard Model given by the steps below.

Inbound Scenarios

Accessing artifacts from External SAP HANA Cloud schema

Your existing schema can be used as an Authoring schema on one of the connections in SAP PAPM Cloud to be used for consumption.

Initially, if you are going to create a Connection in Connection Management screen, your schema is not yet visible to be used as expected.

This is because we need to grant a privilege to the technical schema of SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model which is the equivalent of SAP_PAPM schema.

  1. With this, you need to login on your Standalone HCDB using your external schema credentials using the syntax below:
‚ÄãCONNECT DBMEMBER PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;

      2. Once logged in, perform the SQL syntax below to perform the granting of privileges to the technical schema of your SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model.

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA "DBMEMBER" TO <SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>;

This SQL statement above is performed for your external schema to appear in the list of schema on the creation of HANA connection.

    3. After granting of privileges, you can now go back to your Connection Management Screen and your external schema will be available, then you can choose the artifact you prefer. For example, see image below:

The created connection will be eligible for usage in Modeling and from here, we can now successfully consume the table from your existing external schema.

Disclaimer: Data records used on the image above are all dummy and just to show the successful modeling after the granting of privileges.

Outbound Scenarios

Expose SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model artifacts to external SAP HANA Cloud schema.

If you will be needing the artifacts from SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model to be read by your external SAP HANA Cloud schema, you may follow the procedure below.

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_XXXXX_YYYYY_RT as this user refers to SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like schema which is default database user available after subscription.
‚ÄãCONNECT <SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>_<UniqueID>_RT PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;

       2. Once logged in as the SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_XXXXX_YYYYY_RT user, you may now perform the below SQL Statement syntax to grant the privilege to available artifacts to external schema:

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA ‚ÄúSAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>‚Äù TO ‚Äú<ExternalUser>;‚Äã

This SQL Statement above will allow the external schema to perform a read on y-tables available in SAP PAPM Cloud SM.

SAP_PAPM_SM_<XXXX> refers to schema where the generated artifacts of Standard Model are located. This is similar to the SAP_PAPM schema of default plan.

Writing from SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model to External SAP HANA Cloud Schema

Using the Writer function, SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model can write back to your external SAP HANA Cloud schema. This will be needing additional grants other than select, depending on the Writer type you will be using.

For example, if the required privilege is not yet granted, you will get an error like the image below:

To avoid these kinds of errors, you may follow the procedure below.

  1. Login to your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your external schema credentials.
CONNECT DBMEMBER PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>; ‚Äã

       2. In order for Writer Type to perform Insert , using the credentials of your own external schema , execute the SQL statement below :

GRANT INSERT ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO <SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>>;‚Äã

       3. In order for Writer Type to perform Delete and Insert , using the credentials of your own external schema , execute the SQL statement below

GRANT INSERT ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO <SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>>;
GRANT DELETE ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO <SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>>;

SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID> refers to schema where the generated artifacts of Standard Model are located. This is similar to the SAP_PAPM schema of default plan.

Universal Model

Following the procedures added in the help portal Manage Connections, you may start performing Inbound and Outbound scenarios for Universal Model given by the steps below.

Inbound Scenarios

Accessing artifacts from External SAP HANA Cloud schema

Your existing external SAP HANA Cloud schema can be used as the Target HANA Schema on your connection in your Universal Model.

Still using the DBMEMBER used from Standard Model scenarios, initially, if you are going to create a Connection in Manage Connection screen, your schema is not yet visible to be used as expected.

This is because we need to grant a privilege to the technical schema of SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model.

  1. With this, you need to login on your Standalone HCDB using your external user credentials using the syntax below:
CONNECT DBMEMBER PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      2. Once logged in, perform the SQL Statement syntax below:

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO "SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>::external_privileges_role" WITH GRANT OPTION;‚Äã

This SQL statement above is performed for your external schema to appear in the list of schema on the creation of HANA Schema connection.

However, on the saving of creation of connection, you will encounter and error like the image below:

With this, you will be needing to perform another grant of privilege to the technical schema of Universal Model which you can refer to the syntax below:

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO "SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>#OO" WITH GRANT OPTION;

Once the granting of privileges is done, you may now perform the mapping on your available Model from Target HANA Schema, Activate the Environment and then go to Show data screen to validate the table.

Writing to SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model artifacts (Z-tables) from External SAP HANA Cloud schema

SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model supports Data lifecycle Management, therefore, authorized external SAP HANA Cloud schema can perform writing to existing artifacts(Z-tables).

On the subscription of SAP PAPM Cloud, only Database Administrator has the capability to grant the role collection external_access_role. This role collection consists of select, insert, update and delete privileges.

Adding ‚Äú#‚Äù on the role collection external_access_role# will add a Grant option that will let the user give the same privileges to other users.

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your Database Admin user.
CONNECT DBADMIN PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      2. Once logged in as the DBADMIN, you may now perform the SQL Statement below to grant your _RT user for external access role.

GRANT "SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>"."external_access_role#" TO SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>::external_privileges_role WITH ADMIN OPTION ‚Äã

Note:
external_access_role# role gives read access to the whole ${PAPM_UM} schema and write access to Z tables (Z_* tables) located within the Universal Model schema.

After the run of SQL Statement syntax above, SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>_<UniqueID>_RT schema will have a Grant option that means it can provide the same role to other user.

      3. Login again on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<XXXXX>_<YYYYY>_RT user.

CONNECT SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>_<UniqueID>_RT PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      4. As SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<XXXXX>_<YYYYY>_RT user, grant back DBADMIN the power to give access to your SAP_PAPM_UM_<XXXXX> by following the SQL statement below.

GRANT "SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>"."external_access_role#" TO DBADMIN WITH ADMIN OPTION‚Äã

Note:
external_access_role# role gives read access to the whole ${PAPM_UM} schema and write access to Z tables (Z_* tables) located within the Universal Model schema.

Since SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>_<UniqueID>_RT schema has the Grant option granted from Step 2, we can Grant back the role SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>"."external_access_role#"  to Database Administrator so that it will be able to Grant the role collection to other users.

     5. Login again on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your DBADMIN user.

CONNECT DBADMIN PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

     6. As DBADMIN user, perform the granting of privileges on a specific artifact from SAP PAPM UM by following the SQL Statement below:

GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>.<Z_METABLE> TO <ExternalUser>;‚Äã

Since Database Administrator has now external_access_role#. It can now grant privileges to other users to specific artifacts based on its use cases.
You may also perform a Revoke as Database Administrator that will remove the privileges to your _RT user so that only DBADMIN can manage the granting of privileges to SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID> objects.

REVOKE

"SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>"."external_access_role#" FROM "SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<XXXXX>_<YYYYY>_RT";


For more information, see REVOKE Statement (Access Control).

Outbound Scenarios

Expose Z table entries to external SAP HANA Cloud schema

Follow the procedure outlined below to allow access to your SAP PAPM UM artifacts, such as z-tables and views, from your external SAP HANA Cloud schema:

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_XXXXX_YYYYY_RT as this user refers to SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like schema which is default database user available after subscription.
    <XXXXX> is equal to Tenant ID of the subaccount minus the hyphen.
    <YYYYY> is a random GUID unique for the tenant.

    This SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_TenantID_UniqueID info can be seen from Hamburger Menu > Administration > Setings. Once you have the credentials, you can follow the SQL Statement syntax below:
CONNECT <SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_TenandID_UniqueID_RT PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;

       2. Once logged in as the SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_XXXXX_YYYYY_RT user, you may now perform the below SQL Statement syntax to grant the privilege to available artifacts to external schema:

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA ‚ÄúSAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>‚Äù TO ‚Äú<ExternalUser>;‚Äã

This SQL Statement above will allow the external schema to perform a read on z-tables available in SAP PAPM Cloud UM

SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID> refers to schema where the generated artifacts of Universal Model are located. This is similar to the SAP_PAPM_UM schema of default plan.

Writing from SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model to External SAP HANA Cloud Schema

Follow the procedure outlined below to enable the SAP PAPM Universal Model to perform write operations, such as inserting or deleting data in the tables of your external schema using the Writer Function:

Procedure:

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your external schema credentials.
CONNECT <ExternaUser> PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      2. In order for Writer Type to perform Insert, using the credentials of your own external schema , execute the SQL statement below :

GRANT INSERT ON SCHEMA <ExternalUser> TO SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>#OO;‚Äã

      3. In order for Writer Type to perform Delete and Insert, using the credentials of your own external schema , execute the SQL statement below

GRANT DELETE, INSERT ON SCHEMA <ExternalUser> TO SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>#OO;‚Äã

We are done! I hope all scenarios above will be useful for Administration of your BYOD plan using the Standalone SAP HANA Cloud.

You may also refer to our official documentation on:

  • Standard Model Administration of BYOD Plan on Standalone HANA Cloud Database
  • Universal Model Administration of BYOD Plan on Standalone HANA Cloud Database

Stay tune for the part 2 of this blog post where we will discuss how we can Administer BYOD plan of SAP PAPM Cloud .

Bye for now!

entry.title: Administration of SAP PaPM Cloud using BYOD SAP Datasphere (in SAP BDC)
entry.content:
NOTE: This blogpost is applicable both for SAP Datasphere, SAP Datasphere in SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) and SAP Data Warehouse Cloud (SAP DWC).

Hello Everyone,

Welcome to the 2nd part of the blog post for the discussion on how you can Administer your SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud(SAP PAPM Cloud) with Bring Your Own Database(BYOD) plan.

On the previous blog post Administration of SAP PAPM Cloud using BYOD Standalone SAP HANA Cloud, we have discussed on how you can administer your SAP PAPM Cloud BYOD plan using Standalone Hana Cloud Database(Standalone HCDB).

Now, I will show you how to Administer your SAP PAPM Cloud BYOD Plan using SAP Datasphere as your database.

It is important for you to know that SAP Datasphere uses a runtime database. If you will have a BYOD plan with SAP PAPM Cloud and SAP Datasphere as your database, your SAP PAPM Cloud will also use the same runtime database from SAP Datasphere.

Runtime databases are usually restricted only for administrators. Even so, with the proper authorization or sharing of entities from SAP Datasphere, we can still share data between Spaces.

To maintain the data governance in SAP Datasphere, administrators are creating Spaces where members can acquire, prepare and model data.

These spaces can be used like a working environment for each department within the company.

Let‚Äôs say, you just recently subscribed to SAP PAPM Cloud BYOD plan using your SAP Datasphere as its database, then it is recommended to have your own space that will be capable of accessing calculated and processed data from the artifacts of SAP PAPM Cloud.

This setup will also provide a restriction only for the SAP Datasphere database user added within the space and maintain the governance of artifacts as users can control what can be shared to other spaces.

Since you can use an existing SAP Datasphere to be the database of your BYOD plan of SAP PAPM Cloud, it is normal to expect existing multiple spaces. For example, the image below.

To give an example on this blog post, I explicitly created these two(2) spaces which are HRDEPT space where we will get the data from, while PAPMCLOUD space is where I performed the Universal Model HDI Container mapping.

Our goal on this blog post is to perform data consumption from HRDEPT space to SAP PAPM Cloud modeling which can perform complex calculation and data processing.

Initially, tables and views are not accessible from different spaces. These entities need are to be shared manually by the Space Administrator before other space can read. To give an example see image below:

For more information about objects sharing, see Sharing Entities and Task Chains to Other Spaces.

Once the table is shared, PAPMCLOUD space can now create a view on top of the entity shared by the HRDEPT.

Do not forget to enable the toggle Expose For Consumption to make the view available in the SAP HANA Database Explorer later when we perform the granting of privileges.

For more information on how to create views, see Importing Tables and Views from Sources.

In the SAP HANA Database Explorer, as expected, the View created above will be visible when we logged in as an SAP Datasphere database user.

Disclaimer: All data records being shown above are all test data and for demo purposes only.

SAP Datasphere database users under our Space PAPMCLOUD can access our views and perform granting  SELECT privilege to other users.

Probably you got some hints when we say SAP Datasphere database users can provide an authorization to other users.

Let‚Äôs now proceed with the introduction of BYOD plan of SAP PAPM Cloud.

Similar to Standalone HANA Cloud, this blog post will be divided into three(3) important chapters so you can focus on what is relevant for your use case.

  1. Introducing technical users in SAP Datasphere.
  2. Authorization Grants for Standard Model
  3. Authorization Grants for Universal Model

Introducing technical users in SAP Datasphere

Since you can use multiple SAP PAPM Cloud tenants on one SAP Datasphere it is necessary for you to know what are the available schemas you can use to perform such integration in your own database.

SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like user

Once you subscribed to  SAP PAPM Cloud that uses BYOD plan, a user will be generated in Administration > Settings that you can use to login on your Standalone HCDB.

SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>_RT.

Please take note of this IDs as it will be the indicator who owns the artifact on the Database level in case you have multiple tenants connected to your Standalone HCDB.

Please take note that the Database user above does not equate to the roles granted to SAP_PAPM_ADMIN from default subscription. In BYOD, you have the freedom to grant the roles which you think are needed for your user.

If you wish to add roles like those granted for SAP_PAPM_ADMIN default plan by default, you may visit this Database Role PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE to check the roles.

Below is a sample step on how you can perform the granting of roles:

  1. Create PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE example:
CREATE ROLE PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE;‚Äã

      b. Using the information in Database Role PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE, perform the following SQL, example:

GRANT CATALOG READ TO PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE;‚Äã

To verify you may check in the Database the Role Management section in Database.

Do this for all the succeeding grants.

C. Once done, assign this role to the SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like user which can be found in database settings, example:

GRANT PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE TO SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>;

Technical schemas on Standalone HCDB BYOD plan

For you to have an idea with how you can understand the naming convention of schema available after BYOD subscription, refer to the screenshot and table below.

 

Model

Default Subscription

BYOD Subscription

Standard Model

SAP_PAPM

SAP_PAPM_SM_<TENANTID> is the schema where all artifacts from Standard Model can be found

Standard Model

SAP_PAPM_ADMIN

SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>_RT is the database username in Database Settings 

Universal Model

SAP_PAPM_UM

SAP_PAPM_UM_<TENANTID> is the schema where all artifacts from Universal Model can be found

Standard Model

Following the procedures added in the help portal Connections, you may start performing Inbound and Outbound scenarios for Standard Model given by the steps below.

Inbound Scenarios

Accessing artifacts of Space schema from SAP Datasphere

Your Space schema can be used as an Authoring schema on one of the connections in SAP PAPM Cloud to be used for consumption.

Initially, if you are going to create a Connection in Connection Management screen, your schema is not yet visible to be used as expected.

This is because we need to grant a privilege to the technical schema of SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model which is the equivalent of SAP_PAPM schema.

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Database explorer using your Database user from SAP Datasphere > Space Management > Database Access with the SQL Statement below:
CONNECT <DSP#DBUSER> PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      2. Once logged in as the SAP Datasphere Database user, perform the SQL Statement syntax below:

GRANT SELECT ON "<SPACESCHEMA>"."OBJECT_NAME" TO "SAP_PAPM_SM_<XXXXX>"‚Äã


To maintain the governance in SAP Datasphere. Database user are only capable of granting privilege on specific object under the space schema.

     3. After granting of privileges, you can now go back to your Connection Management Screen and your external schema will be available then you can choose the artifact you prefer. For example, see image below:


The created connection will be eligible for usage in Modeling and from here, we can now successfully consume the table from your existing external schema.

Outbound Scenarios

Expose Y table entries to SAP Datasphere Database user

In order to read SAP PAPM SM Y-tables, you can utilize the SAP HANA Connection in SAP Datasphere by using the credentials provided in the Administration > Settings in SAP PAPM SM Standard Model.

Related information

Integrating SAP PaPM Cloud & SAP Datasphere (in SAP BDC)

Universal Model

Following the procedures added in the help portal Manage Connections, you may start performing Inbound and Outbound scenarios for Universal Model given by the steps below.

Inbound Scenarios

Accessing artifacts of Space schema from SAP Datasphere

Your existing  SAP Datasphere space schema can be used as the Target HANA Schema on your connection in your Universal Model.

Still using the Datasphere database user used from Standard Model scenarios, initially, if you are going to create a Connection in Manage Connection screen, your schema is not yet visible to be used as expected.

This is because we need to grant a privilege to the technical schema of SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model.

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Database explorer using your Database user from SAP Datasphere > Space Management > Database Access with the SQL Statement below:
CONNECT <DSP#DBUSER> PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      2. Once logged in as the SAP Datasphere Database user, perform the SQL Statement syntax below:

GRANT SELECT ON "< SPACESCHEMA >"."<OBJECT_NAME>" TO "SAP_PAPM_UM_<XXXXX>::external_privileges_role" WITH GRANT OPTION;‚Äã

This SQL statement above is for enabling your Space schema to the list of schema on the creation of HANA Schema connection.

However, on the saving of creation of connection, you will encounter and error like the image below:

With this, you will be needing to perform another grant of privilege to the technical schema of Universal Model which you can refer to the syntax below:

GRANT SELECT ON "<SPACESCHEMA>"."<OBJECT_NAME>" TO "SAP_PAPM_UM_<XXXXX>#OO" WITH GRANT OPTION;

Once the granting of privileges is done, you may now perform the mapping on your available Model from Target HANA Schema, Activate the Environment and then go to Show data screen to validate the table.

Outbound Scenarios

Expose Z table entries to SAP Datasphere

SAP PAPM UM artifacts are stored into the HDI Container mapped on SAP Datasphere upon subscription. Therefore, users may use it directly as source when configuring Graphical views in the Data Builder.

For more information, see Importing Tables and Views from Sources.

That will be it! I am hoping that scenarios above are helpful in case you will be using the SAP PAPM Cloud BYOD plan using SAP Datasphere as its database.

You may also refer to our official documentation on:

  • Standard Model Administration of BYOD Plan on SAP Datasphere Database Administration
  • Universal Model Administration of BYOD Plan on SAP Datasphere Database Administration

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Enhancing Report Management with the power of generative AI copilot ‚Äì Joule
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud ‚Äì Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) enthusiasts. 

Joule is an innovative AI designed to manage your personal chats, enter prompts, and delivers responses based on your report's content. Our AI can be conveniently accessed through the floating action button with the Joule icon, which appears in the bottom-right corner of the page in reports. 

Now that you are acquainted with Joule‚Äôs capabilities, let‚Äôs delve deeper into our exploration of Artificial Intelligence in this blog post.‚ÄØ

Prerequisites for using Artificial Intelligence‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

In this section, we will explore the essential components required for harnessing Artificial Intelligence (AI). We will rely on the SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) to cover these prerequisites. For comprehensive guidance on these requirements, visit the SAP Business AI (Joule) Setup‚ÄØ. 

Integrating AI features into the SAP PaPM Cloud SM is a breeze, thanks to a streamlined setup process that involves just five key components.‚ÄØ 

  • SAP AI Core 
  • SAP Launchpad 
  • SAP BTP Destination 
  • Configuring SAP AI Core Destination in Settings 
  • Joule in Reporting 

SAP AI Core 

Let's begin with the process. First, we set up an SAP AI Core instance, the dynamic engine that powers our AI workflows and models. To use generative AI capabilities, choose the SAP AI Core Extended plan.

For more information on how to set up SAP AI Core service visit SAP AI Core.

SAP Launchpad 

The second one is a subscription to SAP AI Launchpad, which helps in deploying predefined SAP AI models.

Next, we deploy our predefined AI Models through the SAP AI Launchpad, a crucial step for their seamless integration into the SAP PaPM Cloud SM.  
Be aware that not all AI models are supported in the SAP PaPM SM. To see which models are supported, please visit the Supported Foundation Models.

For more information on how to set up SAP Launchpad and deploy AI models, visit SAP AI Launchpad.

SAP BTP Destination 

Then we configure the AI core and model settings within the SAP BTP destination, guaranteeing seamless connection.‚ÄØYou can follow the template below: 

 

Attribute‚ÄØ 

Value‚ÄØ 

Destination Name‚ÄØ 

Unique name of destination in current subaccount 

Type‚ÄØ 

HTTP‚ÄØ 

Description‚ÄØ 

Any description for the destination name 

URL‚ÄØ 

<AICoreServiceKey.serviceurls.AI_API_URL>/v2

(from credentials in AI Core service key)‚ÄØ 

Proxy Type‚ÄØ 

Internet‚ÄØ 

Authentication‚ÄØ 

OAuth2ClientCredentials‚ÄØ 

Use mTLS for Token Retrieval‚ÄØ 

Leave this unmarked

Client ID‚ÄØ 

<AICoreServiceKey.clientid>‚ÄØ 

(from credentials in AI Core service key)‚ÄØ 

Client Secret‚ÄØ 

<AICoreServiceKey.clientsecret>‚ÄØ 

(from credentials in AI Core service key)‚ÄØ 

Token Service URL Type‚ÄØ 

Dedicated‚ÄØ 

Token Service URL‚ÄØ 

<AICoreServiceKey.url>/oauth/token‚ÄØ 

(from credentials in AI Core service key)‚ÄØ 

Token Service User‚ÄØ 

(empty)‚ÄØ 

Token Service Password‚ÄØ 

(empty)‚ÄØ 

Additional Properties‚ÄØ 

Enter the following values:‚ÄØ 

ai-resource-group ‚Äì <the Resource Group value from your AI Launchpad workspace> 

Use Default JDK Truststore option is marked.‚ÄØ 

Please refer to the image below to see how the BTP destination should look after it is successfully created. 

For more information on how to set up the BTP destination, visit SAP BTP Destination. 

Configuring SAP AI Core Destination in Settings 

After you have created the destination, you can add it to the Settings in the SAP PaPM Standard Model together with the AI model. This will enable communication between applications running in SAP BTP and the Standard Model to utilize artificial intelligence within the application. 

You can add AI Core destination under Joule AI Settings in the Default AI Core Destination Name by typing the name of the destination or choosing it from the dropdown menu. The dropdown list will show all BTP destinations that you have created. You need to select the destination configured for Joule that has deployed AI models in the SAP Launchpad. 

If you choose a non-AI destination, an error message will appear below the Default AI Model field and Save button will be disabled. 

Now, select the AI model you want to use. When you open the drop-down menu, all configured models in SAP Launchpad will be shown. Supported models will be selectable, while unsupported ones will be grayed out and unavailable.  

For optimal experience, we suggest you to use the recommended model, but you are free to choose any model from the list of Supported Foundation Models.  

After setting up SAP AI Core destination in the Settings, you can now see it and use it in the Reports Management Screen which is the next section in this blogpost. 

Joule in Reporting 

We enhance our reports by utilizing Joule, which enables us to explore data more interactively and provides us with valuable analysis. This approach enables us to fully leverage AI technology, transforming our discoveries into actionable insights that inform our decisions. 

The advantage of Joule is its capacity to understand the context of every report. This functionality makes complex reports much more accessible and practical.  

Accessing Joule is easy, you need to click on the Floating Actin Button in the lower right corner of the screen, and Joule chat will be opened. 

Now, we can see how Joule responds to our questions. You can ask a question about some topic from the report. By simply asking Joule, we will receive an immediate response. 

Note: If you're accessing a report for the first time, you need to save it by clicking Edit and then Save in the General header section. 

You can start a new chat by clicking on the button Start new chat in top right corner of the Joule chat, the previous chat will be removed, and you will only see the new chat. To close the Joule chat you need to click on the Close Joule button, which is located next to the Start new chat button. 

Each chat session you create in Joule Chat is your personal space - completely private and visible only to you. The Joule chat is available on all pages in your report and can answer questions about topics from all pages, regardless of which page you are currently on. The chat you have started will remain available on the report screen until you initiate a new chat or refresh the screen.  

Joule enhances SAP PaPM Cloud SM by turning complex reports into clear, actionable insights through the power of AI. 

I hope you find these updates helpful!‚ÄØ

Stay tuned for the latest updates and insights in the next one. Thank you!‚ÄØ

entry.title: Where can I learn how to administrate SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Administrating SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud, Universal Model learning journey.

Overview
This course is designed to equip participants with the skills necessary to effectively manage and administer SAP's Profitability and Performance Management Cloud using the Universal Model. This training provides a comprehensive understanding of the subscription process, role management, team restrictions, authorization, event logs, connection setups, and administration applications within the SAP Business Technology Platform. Participants will learn to navigate the complexities of SAP PaPM Cloud, ensuring efficient data management, security, and performance optimization.

Learning Objectives
  • Understand the subscription process and activation of the Universal Model in SAP Business Technology Platform.
